arts.ttl: World Cup qualifying: Armenia stun Republic of Ireland while Norway hit 11
arts.sum: Hallgrímsson under pressure after 2-1 away defeat Haaland hits five but City teammate Marmoush injured Republic of Ireland’s World Cup dream was torn to shreds in Yerevan as Heimir Hallgrímsson’s men lost 2-1 against Armenia. A little more than three years after they endured an embarrassing 1-0 Nations League defeat at the Republican Stadium, Ireland lost 2-1 against a side ranked 105th in the world, in a game they had to win if they were to stand a realistic chance of qualifying from Group F following a 2-2 draw with Hungary in Dublin on Saturday. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Rep of Ireland suffer humbling WC qualifying defeat to Armenia
arts.sum: Heimir Hallgrimsson's World Cup dream was torn to shreds in Yerevan as the Republic of Ireland were humbled by Armenia.

arts.ttl: Republic of Ireland’s World Cup qualifying hopes hit further by loss in Armenia
arts.sum: Evan Ferguson pulled a goal back for Heimir Hallgrimsson’s team, but to no avail.

arts.ttl: Armenia vs Ireland – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Armenia and Ireland go head-to-head in their second 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifier on Monday evening. Both sides will be searching for crucial points in Group F, with Ireland coming off a dramatic 2-2 draw with Hungary while Armenia suffered a heavy 5-0 defeat to Portugal. The hosts welcome the Irish side to Yerevan following a heavy 5-0 defeat to Portugal in their opening qualifying fixture.
